column4: i opened a screen session in a machine. how do i attach it to it from another machine
Ctrl-a d to detach, screen -r to resaume
i get the followoing messages when i do it
screen -r There are screens on:         3210.tty6.newton        (Attached)         3315.pts-1.newton       (Attached) There is no screen to be resumed.
when i do ps ; i see screen process running
fist you need to detach the screen with ctrl-a d
or you can connect with screen -x
why i get only half the screen
i need full screen at the other pc. i do screen -x pid
that's because it it still atached on another terminal.. that's why the format doesn't adapt, so detach the aother session first with ctrl-a d
i dont understand when you say that
the problem is i connect to a server. my telnet session keeps breaking because of network related issue. so i run a screen program in server and try to attach it to
ii run screen in server. and screen -x in my client
on the server you issue in screen the key combination ctrl-a d  that detaches your session
the you do the same on client side and the on client side screen -r
ramesho get DSL (dhamn small linux) it's only 50 mb afaik
ramesho or download debien netinst cd , it's only 150 MB or so..
